back_cards.definition_en: A command or instruction given by someone in authority.
back_cards.example_en: The general gave an order to advance the troops.

back_cards.definition_en: The arrangement or sequence of items or events.
back_cards.example_en: She organized the books in alphabetical order on the shelf.

back_cards.definition_en: A request for goods or services from a business.
back_cards.example_en: He placed an order for a new laptop online.

back_cards.definition_en: A state of organization or tidiness.
back_cards.example_en: The room was in perfect order before the guests arrived.

back_cards.definition_en: A social or political system.
back_cards.example_en: The new law aimed to maintain public order in the city.

back_cards.definition_en: To divide and distribute something among others.
back_cards.example_en: She decided to share her lunch with her friend.

back_cards.definition_en: To have or use something jointly with others.
back_cards.example_en: The roommates share a small apartment in the city.

back_cards.definition_en: To express or communicate thoughts or feelings.
back_cards.example_en: He shared his excitement about the new project at work.

back_cards.definition_en: To give a portion of something, like stock or profits.
back_cards.example_en: The company will share its annual profits with employees.

back_cards.definition_en: To participate in a shared activity or experience.
back_cards.example_en: They share a love for hiking in the mountains.

back_cards.definition_en: A printed publication with news and articles.
back_cards.example_en: She reads the newspaper every morning with her coffee.

back_cards.definition_en: A source of current events and information.
back_cards.example_en: The newspaper reported on the recent election results.

back_cards.definition_en: A medium for advertisements and local updates.
back_cards.example_en: The local newspaper listed community events for the weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: A collection of editorials and opinions.
back_cards.example_en: His article was published in the newspaper’s opinion section.

back_cards.definition_en: A physical object used in daily routines.
back_cards.example_en: He used an old newspaper to clean the windows.

back_cards.definition_en: The base on which a building is constructed.
back_cards.example_en: The workers poured concrete for the house’s foundation.

back_cards.definition_en: An organization created for a specific purpose, often charitable.
back_cards.example_en: The foundation donated funds to support education.

back_cards.definition_en: The underlying basis or principle of something.
back_cards.example_en: Trust is the foundation of a strong relationship.

back_cards.definition_en: A starting point or groundwork for an idea.
back_cards.example_en: Her research laid the foundation for new discoveries.

back_cards.definition_en: A cosmetic product used as a base for makeup.
back_cards.example_en: She applied foundation to even out her skin tone.

back_cards.definition_en: A range of different things or types.
back_cards.example_en: The store offers a variety of fruits and vegetables.

back_cards.definition_en: Diversity in characteristics or qualities.
back_cards.example_en: The festival celebrated the variety of cultures in the city.

back_cards.definition_en: A specific type or kind within a group.
back_cards.example_en: This variety of rose blooms in bright red.

back_cards.definition_en: A collection of assorted items or experiences.
back_cards.example_en: Her job involves a variety of tasks every day.

back_cards.definition_en: A form of entertainment with diverse acts.
back_cards.example_en: The variety show featured singers, dancers, and comedians.

back_cards.definition_en: A point of view or way of thinking.
back_cards.example_en: Her perspective on the issue changed after the discussion.

back_cards.definition_en: A way of understanding or interpreting something.
back_cards.example_en: The book offers a fresh perspective on history.

back_cards.definition_en: A technique in art to represent depth and distance.
back_cards.example_en: The painting used perspective to create a 3D effect.

back_cards.definition_en: An attitude toward a situation or problem.
back_cards.example_en: He maintained a positive perspective despite challenges.

back_cards.definition_en: A sense of proportion or relative importance.
back_cards.example_en: Traveling abroad gave her perspective on her own life.

back_cards.definition_en: A written or printed record containing information.
back_cards.example_en: She signed the document to finalize the agreement.

back_cards.definition_en: An official paper used for legal or formal purposes.
back_cards.example_en: He needed a passport as a document for travel.

back_cards.definition_en: A digital file containing text or data.
back_cards.example_en: The document was saved on her computer for review.

back_cards.definition_en: A source of evidence or proof.
back_cards.example_en: The letter served as a document of their friendship.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of work, like a report or essay.
back_cards.example_en: She spent hours editing the document for her boss.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of being in a particular place.
back_cards.example_en: Her presence at the meeting made everyone feel confident.

back_cards.definition_en: A sense of someone or something being nearby.
back_cards.example_en: He felt a strange presence in the old house.

back_cards.definition_en: The impression or influence someone has.
back_cards.example_en: The speaker had a commanding presence on stage.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of attending or being involved.
back_cards.example_en: The company expanded its presence in the global market.

back_cards.definition_en: A quality of charisma or aura.
back_cards.example_en: Her calm presence soothed the nervous team.

back_cards.definition_en: To look at something or someone intensely.
back_cards.example_en: She stared at the stars in the night sky.

back_cards.definition_en: To gaze with surprise or disbelief.
back_cards.example_en: He stared at the unexpected gift in amazement.

back_cards.definition_en: To focus attention with a fixed look.
back_cards.example_en: The cat stared at the bird outside the window.

back_cards.definition_en: To look in a way that makes someone uncomfortable.
back_cards.example_en: He felt uneasy when strangers stared at him.

back_cards.definition_en: To observe closely in a thoughtful manner.
back_cards.example_en: She stared at the painting, admiring its details.

back_cards.definition_en: A period of instruction or learning.
back_cards.example_en: The math lesson helped her understand fractions better.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of knowledge gained from experience.
back_cards.example_en: Failing the test taught him a valuable lesson.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a course or training session.
back_cards.example_en: Today’s lesson focused on conversational English.

back_cards.definition_en: An example or moral teaching.
back_cards.example_en: The story of the ant and grasshopper offers a lesson.

back_cards.definition_en: A section of a book or study material.
back_cards.example_en: She completed the final lesson in her textbook.

back_cards.definition_en: A boundary or restriction on something.
back_cards.example_en: The speed limit on this road is 40 miles per hour.

back_cards.definition_en: The maximum amount allowed or possible.
back_cards.example_en: There’s a limit of two bags per passenger.

back_cards.definition_en: A point beyond which something cannot go.
back_cards.example_en: Her patience reached its limit after hours of waiting.

back_cards.definition_en: A constraint in a specific context, like time.
back_cards.example_en: The project had a strict time limit of one month.

back_cards.definition_en: A cap on resources or opportunities.
back_cards.example_en: The budget limit forced them to cut expenses.

back_cards.definition_en: To be grateful or thankful for something.
back_cards.example_en: She appreciated the help during her move.

back_cards.definition_en: To recognize the value or quality of something.
back_cards.example_en: He appreciates fine art and visits galleries often.

back_cards.definition_en: To understand or be aware of a situation.
back_cards.example_en: I appreciate how difficult this task must be for you.

back_cards.definition_en: To increase in value over time.
back_cards.example_en: The house’s value appreciated significantly in five years.

back_cards.definition_en: To enjoy or take pleasure in something.
back_cards.example_en: They appreciated the beautiful sunset at the beach.

back_cards.definition_en: To finish or bring something to an end.
back_cards.example_en: She completed the puzzle in just one hour.

back_cards.definition_en: To make something whole or perfect.
back_cards.example_en: He completed the collection by buying the rare coin.

back_cards.definition_en: To fulfill or accomplish a task.
back_cards.example_en: They completed the project before the deadline.

back_cards.definition_en: To fill out or finalize, as with forms.
back_cards.example_en: Please complete the application form by tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: To achieve a state of being finished.
back_cards.example_en: The team completed the marathon together.

back_cards.definition_en: To watch carefully or notice something.
back_cards.example_en: She observed the birds nesting in the tree.

back_cards.definition_en: To follow or obey a rule or custom.
back_cards.example_en: They observe the tradition of giving thanks before meals.

back_cards.definition_en: To make a remark or comment.
back_cards.example_en: He observed that the weather was unusually warm.

back_cards.definition_en: To study or monitor closely.
back_cards.example_en: Scientists observed the behavior of the animals in the wild.

back_cards.definition_en: To celebrate or acknowledge an event.
back_cards.example_en: The community observes Earth Day with clean-up events.

back_cards.definition_en: At the present time or moment.
back_cards.example_en: She is currently working on a new book.

back_cards.definition_en: In the immediate or ongoing situation.
back_cards.example_en: The store is currently closed for renovations.

back_cards.definition_en: As things stand now.
back_cards.example_en: He is currently the team’s top scorer.

back_cards.definition_en: At this point in time.
back_cards.example_en: They are currently living in a small apartment.

back_cards.definition_en: In the context of the present.
back_cards.example_en: The project is currently on hold due to funding.

back_cards.definition_en: The number equal to ten times ten.
back_cards.example_en: She counted a hundred stars in the night sky.

back_cards.definition_en: A large, approximate number of things.
back_cards.example_en: Hundreds of people attended the concert.

back_cards.definition_en: A unit in counting or measurement.
back_cards.example_en: The race was a hundred meters long.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for a group of one hundred items.
back_cards.example_en: He bought a hundred apples for the event.

back_cards.definition_en: A historical term for a division of land.
back_cards.example_en: The old county was divided into several hundreds.

back_cards.definition_en: Enjoyment or pleasure from an activity.
back_cards.example_en: The picnic was full of fun for the kids.

back_cards.definition_en: A source of amusement or entertainment.
back_cards.example_en: Playing board games is her idea of fun.

back_cards.definition_en: A lighthearted or playful experience.
back_cards.example_en: They had fun exploring the new park.

back_cards.definition_en: A feeling of joy in social settings.
back_cards.example_en: The party was so much fun last night.

back_cards.definition_en: An activity done for enjoyment.
back_cards.example_en: Hiking in the forest is always fun for them.

back_cards.definition_en: A large group of people gathered together.
back_cards.example_en: A crowd gathered to watch the street performer.

back_cards.definition_en: A mass of people in a public place.
back_cards.example_en: The crowd cheered loudly at the football game.

back_cards.definition_en: A specific group or social circle.
back_cards.example_en: She hangs out with the art crowd at school.

back_cards.definition_en: A dense collection of objects or things.
back_cards.example_en: A crowd of trees filled the forest.

back_cards.definition_en: A large number of participants in an event.
back_cards.example_en: The concert drew a huge crowd last night.

back_cards.definition_en: A violent act intended to harm.
back_cards.example_en: The sudden attack surprised the small village.

back_cards.definition_en: A strong verbal or critical assault.
back_cards.example_en: Her speech was an attack on unfair policies.

back_cards.definition_en: A sudden onset of illness or symptoms.
back_cards.example_en: He suffered a heart attack last week.

back_cards.definition_en: An aggressive move in sports or games.
back_cards.example_en: The team planned a strong attack in the second half.

back_cards.definition_en: An attempt to damage or destroy something.
back_cards.example_en: The virus was an attack on the computer system.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of rooms for living in, typically rented.
back_cards.example_en: She moved into a cozy apartment downtown.

back_cards.definition_en: A residential unit within a larger building.
back_cards.example_en: Their apartment is on the fifth floor.

back_cards.definition_en: A private space for personal living.
back_cards.example_en: He decorated his apartment with modern furniture.

back_cards.definition_en: A temporary home during travel or relocation.
back_cards.example_en: They stayed in an apartment during their vacation.

back_cards.definition_en: A place associated with urban lifestyle.
back_cards.example_en: Living in an apartment suits her busy schedule.
